repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection consists of records relating to the Washington, D.C. restaurant Ben's Chili Bowl dating from 1943-2018.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ben's Chili Bowl was founded on August 22, 1958, by Ben Ali, a Trinidadian-born immigrant and his fiancee, Virginia Rollins. The building they chose was that of Washington's first silent movie house, the Minnehaha. The building is a contributing property to the Greater U Street Historic District. At the time, Washington was officially segregated, and U Street was known as "Black Broadway".

The U Street corridor was devastated by the 1968 civil unrest that followed the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr. During the civil unrest, black activist Stokely Carmichael, leader of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee, asked Ben to keep his restaurant open and the Alis obtained permission to stay open past curfew. The restaurant fed both the police officers and firemen working to impose order on the neighborhood, as well as the black activists.

The destruction of so many businesses led to the flight of residents towards the suburbs and the economic decline of the neighborhood through the mid-1970s to mid-1980s. The vast construction of the U Street/Cardozo Metro Station across the street from the restaurant, completed in 1991, forced still more U Street businesses to close, but Ben's Chili Bowl stayed open to feed the construction workers.

In 2008, Ben's Chili Bowl opened a second location in the newly built Nationals Park. On October 7, 2009, Ben died at the age of 82. He and his wife, Virginia, had retired from the restaurant business, having passed daily operations of Ben's Chili Bowl to their sons, Kamal and Nizam.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains business records, correspondence, historical documents, financial records, photographs, and clippings. The material dates from 1943-2018. These are the records of the Ali family chronicling the establishment and maintaining of the Ben's Chili Bowl restaurant.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 5 series: Historical records, Business records, Community outreach, Photographs, Publicity/Press

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Related
relatedmaterial.p: In 2020 Sonali Mirpuri donated a digital copy of her Georgetown Honors Thesis titled Mahaboob Ben Ali and His Chili Bowl: A Story of Family and Identity in the U Street Corridor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains historical material that document the history of Ben Ali and Ben's Chili Bowl. Materials included are Ben Ali's personal documents, interviews and material from the 40th,45th and 50th Anniversaries of Ben's Chili Bowl's opening. Material dates from 1943-2018.

odd.head: General
odd.p: One menu for Ben's Chili Bowl and one menu for Next Door restaurant + bar

odd.p: Poster reads half smoke eating contest" H St. NE festival Ben's Chili Bowl.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material that pertain to the business operation of Ben's Chili Bowl dating from 1959-2014. Included are payroll books, correspondence, promotional designs, employee manuals, invoices and grant requests.

did.unittitle: Ben's Bakery and Ice Cream material
Filming for The Pelican Brief records
Public officials - testimonies, remarks, proclimations and flyers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: alphabetically by project or organization, then chronologically

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material pertaining to nonprofrit work by Virginia and Nizam Ali. Included are handbooks, meeting minutes, correspondence, agendas and budgets dating from 1993-2011.

did.unittitle: D.C. Civil Rights Veterans History project
School papers written about Ben's Chili Bowl
Documentary proposal: The Story of the Nations Capital

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the Ali family's presonal collection of photographs. Subjects covered include, the Ali family, visits by celebrities, politicians, metro construction and coverage of the 40, 45 and 50 Anniversaries.

did.unittitle: Events- American Cancer Society press conference
Events- Dedication of Ben Ali Way

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains material relating to press coverage of Ben's Chili Bowl. Included are an extensive collection of press clippings from 1958-2013.
